extraction_metadata.confidence_note: Relationships stated in genealogical compilation = PROBABLE unless marked otherwise

individuals.notes: Ancient Planter. Arrived Virginia by 1618. Listed in 1624/1625 Muster at Jamestown. 200 acres at Archer's Hope. Exempt from levies 1653 due to lameness from 1644 massacre.

match_existing.reason: Exact match: Ancient Planter, Archer's Hope, William Spencer adjacent

individuals.notes: Wife of John Johnson the Ancient Planter. Listed in 1624 Muster at Jamestown.
Daughter of John Johnson Ancient Planter. Age 4 in 1625 Muster. Married Edward Travis I. Inherited father's lands via marital right.

Son of John Johnson Ancient Planter. Age 1 in 1625 Muster. Repatented father's land 1652. Moved to Northumberland County. Married Ann Goche c.1655. Exempt from levies 1653 due to lameness from service in 1644 massacre.
Married Ann Johnson (daughter of Ancient Planter). Patented 900 acres James City County 1637 'in right of John Johnson, his wife and two children'.
Wife of John Johnson Jr. Sister or niece of Jeffrey Goche. Related to Samuel Goche.

Son of John Johnson Jr. and Ann Goche. Received land from Samuel Goche 1663 as infant. Married Elizabeth (Wright?) c.1688. Will dated 25 Jun 1725, probated King George County Oct 1726. Land at Elk Run.
Wife of Jeffrey Johnson I. Named in 1707 land record.
Daughter of John Johnson Jr. and Ann Goche. Married (1) Samuel Goche (d. 1683), (2) Peter Byram. Litigant in Goche estate matters.
Son of John Goche and Katherine. Married Anne Johnson. 1663 deed of gift to nephew Jeffrey Johnson. Uncle of Jeffrey Johnson I.
Land patents south side Greater Wiccomico River 1650. Brother or uncle of Ann Goche. Land on Cupid's Creek.
Second husband of Anne Johnson (daughter of John Jr.).
Son of Jeffrey Johnson I. Executor of father's will. Planter. 492-acre lease on Darrell's Run 1732. Will dated 23 Feb 1758. Married Margaret c.1720.
Son of Jeffrey Johnson I. Married Susanna before 1724. Inherited plantation at Elk Run per 1725 will. Lived Stafford County, died after 1763 in Fauquier.
Wife of Jeffrey Johnson II. Married (2) Thomas Colson of Frederick County after Jeffrey's death. 1759 agreement with sons Jeffrey III and Moses.
Grandson named in Jeffrey Johnson I's 1725 will. Son of John or Jeffrey II.
Son of Jeffrey Johnson II. Married Rachel Walker. Leader of North Carolina migration.
Son of Jeffrey Johnson II. DAR Patriot (A207620). Married Duannah Shumate 1768. Resident of Leeds Parish. Will dated 16 Jun 1803, proved 25 Jul 1803.
Wife of Moses Johnson. Daughter of Daniel Shumate II and Mary. French Huguenot descent (Chaumette).
Second husband of Margaret (widow of Jeffrey Johnson II). 1759 agreement with stepsons Jeffrey III and Moses.
Son of Samuel Goche and Anne Johnson. Sued uncle Jeffrey Johnson in General Court 1690, settled amicably 1696/7.
Son of Moses Johnson and Duannah Shumate. Married Sarah Odor 21 Mar 1789.
Son of Moses Johnson. Married Polly Adams 24 Feb 1790.
Daughter of Moses Johnson. Married John Burgess 12 Nov 1805.

relationships.source: 1624/1625 Muster lists 'John Johnson & Ann his wife'
1625 Muster lists Ann as daughter, age 4
1625 Muster lists John as son, age 1. 1652 repatent states 'son and heir of said John Johnson'
1637 patent mentions Travis 'marrying' daughter of John Johnson
Multiple records state John Johnson married Ann Goche c.1655
1663 deed: 'Jeffrey JOHNSON son of Jno JOHNSON'
Records indicate Anne Johnson daughter of John Johnson Jr.
Records state Anne Johnson married Samuel Goche (first husband)
Records state Anne Johnson married Peter Byram (second husband)
1690 lawsuit: 'John GOCHE, son and heir of Saml GOCHE'
1707 land record mentions Elizabeth wife of Jeffrey Johnson
1725 will names Jeffrey as executor; 1726 probate 'Jeffery JOHNSON, his Executor'
1725 will: 'I give to my son John JOHNSON the plantation whereon He now dwells'
1752 deed mentions 'Margaret the wife of said Jeffrey'
1758 will and 1759 agreement name Jeffrey as son
1758 will and 1759 agreement name Moses as son
Marriage records and DAR documentation
1803 will names David as heir
1803 will names Nimrod as heir
1803 will names Charlotte as heir
Marriage record

events.title: 1624/1625 Muster - John Johnson household
events.description: John Johnson established at Jamestown with wife Ann and two children: John (age 1) and Ann (age 4)

events.title: John Johnson patent 100 acres Archer's Hope
events.description: John Johnson, yeoman and ancient planter of James City, 100 acres, his first person dividend. 15 acres on east toward Back River, 85 acres on small branch of Archer's Hope Creek, parting from land of Ensign William Spencer.

events.title: Edward Travis patent 900 acres
events.description: Edward Travis I patented 900 acres upon head of Upper Chippokes Creek, adjacent Jeremiah Dickenson 200 acres. Due in right of John Johnson, his wife and two children, the daughter and heir of said John Johnson, he said Travis marrying. Headrights include Walter Johnson and Walter Travis.

participants.note: daughter and heir of John Johnson

events.title: John Johnson Jr. repatent of father's land
events.description: John repatented land granted to his father John Johnson 12 Jan 1624, being son and heir of said John Johnson.

events.title: John Johnson exempt from levies
events.description: John Johnson to be exempt from paying county and country levies in respect of his lameness and inability to work which was contracted in the service of the country in the last massacre (1644).

events.title: Samuel Goche deed of gift to Jeffrey Johnson
events.location: Greater Wiccomico Parish, Northumberland County, Virginia
events.description: Sam Goche of Greater Wiccocomicoe Parish gives to Jeffrey Johnson son of Jno Johnson of Greater Wiccomicoe Parish one half of plantation he now owns from deed of gift from his Uncle Jeffrey Goche. Provision that Jno Johnson and Anne father and mother of said Jeffrey have use of the plantation.
events.source: Northumberland County Record Book, recorded 10 Dec 1666

events.title: John Goche vs Jeffrey Johnson
events.description: John Goche, son and heir of Samuel Goche, sued Jeffrey Johnson in General Court. Settled amicably 20 Jan 1696/7.

events.title: Jeffrey Johnson I will
events.description: In the name of God; Amen. I Jeffrey Johnson of the county of King George County, Virginia... I give to my son John Johnson the plantation whereon He now dwells with one hundred acres... I give to my grandson William Johnson the remaining part of the tract of land after his father's decease...

participants.note: grandson, receives remaining land after father's decease

events.source: King George County Will Book 1, page 26

events.title: Jeffrey Johnson I will probate
events.description: Will of Jeffery Johnson, deceased was presented unto court by Jeffery Johnson, his Executor, who made oath thereto and proved by the oath of Charles Morgan and admitted to record.

events.title: Jeffrey Johnson II will
events.description: Will of Jeffrey Johnson II dividing estate between sons Jeffrey and Moses, with other children receiving 25 shillings each.

events.title: Thomas Colson and Margaret agreement with Jeffrey and Moses Johnson
events.description: Articles of agreement between Thomas Colson and Margaret (his wife, widow of Jeffrey Johnson) of Frederick County and Jeffrey Johnson and Moses Johnson of Hamilton Parish. Regarding division of Jeffrey Johnson deceased's estate.

events.title: Moses Johnson will
events.description: Will of Moses Johnston Senior of Leeds Parish in the County of Fauquier naming wife Duannah and children including David, Nimrod, Daniel, Susanna, Margaret, Moses Jr., Hannah, Molly, Polly, and Charlotte.

events.title: Moses Johnson will probate
events.description: Will of Moses Johnson proved by oaths of James Ellis, Joseph Ellis and Isham Bannon.

events.title: Charlotte Johnson marriage to John Burgess

associated_persons.name: William Spencer
associated_persons.title: Ensign
associated_persons.relationship_to_family: Adjacent landowner to John Johnson Ancient Planter 1624
associated_persons.notes: Deceased by 1624; John Johnson ordered to repair his dwelling

associated_persons.name: Jeremiah Dickenson
associated_persons.relationship_to_family: Adjacent landowner to Edward Travis 1637 patent

associated_persons.name: Walter Johnson
associated_persons.notes: Possibly son of John Johnson Ancient Planter

associated_persons.name: Daniel Shumate II
associated_persons.relationship_to_family: Father of Duannah Shumate (wife of Moses Johnson)

sources.title: THE JOHN JOHNSON FAMILY IN AMERICA
sources.notes: Primary source document for this extraction

sources.title: Virginia Colonial Abstracts Northumbria Collectanea, 1645-1720, A-L
